intro: Drapetes villosa var. multicaulis, commonly known as the hairy drapetis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered foliage, which help it retain moisture in its arid or semi-arid habitat. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green, adding to its ornamental value. Its botanical structure includes a short, fibrous root system and multiple stems that arise from the base, contributing to its unique growth form. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
